intro: Malvaviscus pentacarpus, commonly known as the five-armed velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces five-lobed fruit capsules, which give it its scientific name. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Malvaviscus pentacarpus is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
